com.immersion.uhl
Class WaveformEffectDefinition

java.lang.Object
  com.immersion.uhl.WaveformEffectDefinition

public class WaveformEffectDefinition
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates the parameters of a Waveform effect.

Constructor Detail

WaveformEffectDefinition

public WaveformEffectDefinition(byte[] data,
                                int dataSize,
                                int sampleRate,
                                int bitDepth,
                                int magnitude,
                                int actuatorIndex)
Initializes this Waveform effect with the given parameters.

Parameters:
data - PCM data defining the actuator drive signal for the Waveform effect. The data is formatted in the same way as the PCM data in a WAV file with the exception that only 8-bit and 16-bit mono (not stereo) samples are supported.
dataSize - Size of the PCM data in bytes. The size must be greater than zero. The maximum supported size is 16 megabytes, or less if limited by platform constraints.
sampleRate - Sampling rate of PCM data in Hertz (number of samples per second).
bitDepth - Bit depth of PCM data, or number of bits per sample. The only supported values are 8 and 16; that is, the Player supports only 8-bit and 16-bit PCM data.
magnitude - Magnitude of the effect. The effect magnitude goes from ImmVibe.VIBE_MIN_MAGNITUDE to ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE, inclusive. When set to ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE, the PCM data samples are not attenuated. Magnitude values less than ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE, serve to attenuate the PCM data samples.
actuatorIndex - Index of the actuator on which to play the effect when the effect is in an IVTMagSweepElement, and the IVTMagSweepElement is in an IVTBuffer, and the effect is played from the IVTBuffer using Device.playIVTEffect on a composite device supporting effects targeting multiple actuators simultaneously. This value is not used when playing the effect on its own, outside of an IVTBuffer, even when played on a composite device. The actuator index goes from zero to ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_LOGICAL_DEVICE_COUNT.

public void setData(byte[] data)
Sets the PCM data of this Waveform effect definition.

Parameters:
data - PCM data defining the actuator drive signal for the Waveform effect. The data is formatted in the same way as the PCM data in a WAV file with the exception that only 8-bit and 16-bit mono (not stereo) samples are supported.

Bit depth of PCM data, or number of bits per sample. The only supported values are 8 and 16; that is, the Player supports only 8-bit and 16-bit PCM data.

setMagnitude

public void setMagnitude(int magnitude)
Sets the magnitude of this Waveform effect definition.

Parameters:
magnitude - Magnitude of the effect. The effect magnitude goes from ImmVibe.VIBE_MIN_MAGNITUDE to ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE, inclusive. When set to ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE, the PCM data samples are not attenuated. Magnitude values less than ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE, serve to attenuate the PCM data samples.

getMagnitude

public int getMagnitude()
Gets the magnitude of this Waveform effect definition.

Returns:
Magnitude of the effect. The effect magnitude goes from ImmVibe.VIBE_MIN_MAGNITUDE to ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE, inclusive. When set to ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE, the PCM data samples are not attenuated. Magnitude values less than ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE, serve to attenuate the PCM data samples.

setActuatorIndex

public void setActuatorIndex(int actuatorIndex)
Sets the actuator index of this Waveform effect definition.

Parameters:
actuatorIndex - Index of the actuator on which to play the effect when the effect is in an IVTMagSweepElement, and the IVTMagSweepElement is in an IVTBuffer, and the effect is played from the IVTBuffer using Device.playIVTEffect on a composite device supporting effects targeting multiple actuators simultaneously. This value is not used when playing the effect on its own, outside of an IVTBuffer, even when played on a composite device. The actuator index goes from zero to ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_LOGICAL_DEVICE_COUNT.

public int getActuatorIndex()
Gets the actuator index of this Waveform effect definition.

Returns:
Index of the actuator on which to play the effect when the effect is in an IVTMagSweepElement, and the IVTMagSweepElement is in an IVTBuffer, and the effect is played from the IVTBuffer using Device.playIVTEffect on a composite device supporting effects targeting multiple actuators simultaneously. This value is not used when playing the effect on its own, outside of an IVTBuffer, even when played on a composite device. The actuator index goes from zero to ImmVibe.VIBE_MAX_LOGICAL_DEVICE_COUNT.
